messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
The guy at +12453344098, I feel like we don't talk much anymore. Get him out of my contacts.

I can remove the contact, but I need to know which entry in your contact list it is. Could you tell me the name that appears for the contact (or any other detail you see, like their relationship or a unique identifier), so I’m sure I delete the correct one?
I don't know the name or anything. Just have the number, sorry.

No problem—you can still remove him, but I need some unique piece of information the system recognizes (for example, the contact’s name or the internal ID you see when you open the contact details). Could you open that contact on your phone and tell me what name or ID shows up?
I literally only have the phone number: +12453344098. Don't have any name or other stuff.

I’m sorry—I can only delete a contact when I have its unique “person ID.” If you open that phone-number entry in your contacts app and scroll to the very bottom (or tap “Contact Info”), you should see something like “ID,” “Contact ID,” or “person_id” (often a long string of letters and numbers). Could you copy-paste that here? Once you provide it, I can remove the contact right away.
I don't see an ID or anything like that when I look at my contacts. Just have the number.

I’m afraid I can’t delete a contact without its internal “person ID” (that’s how the system makes sure the right entry is touched).  

Here’s what you can do:

1. Open that contact in your phone’s Contacts app.  
2. Look for a section called “Contact ID,” “person_id,” or sometimes just “ID” (it may be at the bottom under “Notes,” “More Info,” or inside an “Edit” screen).  
3. Copy-paste that long string of letters/numbers here.

Once you send me that ID, I can remove the entry immediately. If your app truly doesn’t show an ID anywhere, the quickest workaround is to delete the contact directly in your phone’s Contacts app.
